RFO Namespace Reference

Basic class to allows the definition of reference order execution. More...

Classes

struct  AccessMode
 Access modeMode of access to shared data. Using binary representation [bit3 | bit2 | bit1 | bit0], bit1 is set iff mode is a concurrent mode (r or cw) bit3 is set iff mode is a postponed, other bits are used for identification. More...
class  ClosureAttribut
 Type of attribut for a closureThis type allows to code attribut for a closure on an 32 bits unsigned integer. Default attributs are stored from bit 0 to bit 2 :

  • bit0 is the stealable attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure could not be theft
  • bit1 is the uniqueness attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure execution should be unique [Not implemented]
  • bit2 is the local attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure should be steal only by local thread
  • bit3 is the site attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure has a site constraint
  • bit4 is the ocr attribut which equals to 1 iff the closure has an ocr mapping constraint The attribut may be extended by users: The representation is on 32 bits unsigned integer.
More...
class  BaseClosure
 A closure object is a call to a function. It is also called task.The closure is created to represent a computation. Using closure the users may split its works into subcomputation called closures. A closure has a runtime state that is inherited from Core::Condition which allows to defined five states, INIT, EXEC, STEAL, WAIT, and TERM. The state diagram is the following. Note that the state EXEC also represents closures that are ready and, at the end, terminated. More...
class  Closure
 A closure object is a call to a function. It is also called task.Closure of type Closure is based closure that can be pushed into Frame container. BaseClosure for the purpose of closure object. More...
class  Frame
 Frame is a list of ordered closure.The frame correspond to an activation frame associated to each evaluation of closure, i.e. a call to function. A frame stores the list of created closures using the order of creation. Each newly created closure is added into the back side of the list, while they are consumed in the front side (FIFO queue). Frames are order into a stack. More...

class  ODotStream
 DotStream to dump dot representation of Data Flow GraphThe ODotStream is a wrapper object that allows to insert objects to define element of task's graph such as Graph, SubGraph, Task, AccessLink and OrderLink. Output is the dot language and some attributs for graphical representation may be specify using properties file, or the parsing of command line options. More...

class  Thread
 Flow of control with data flow graph representationThe RFO::Thread represents computation (work) as a list of Task managed by the Reference Order for Athapascan1. Tasks are assumed to be independent: stealing a RFO::Thread will returned, if exists, the last recent task of the stack following the reference order of execution. More...

Detailed Description

Basic class to allows the definition of reference order execution.
